clientInfo.name: Brad Hargreaves
clientInfo.title: I analyze emerging real estate trends | 3x founder | $500m+ of exits | Thesis Driven Founder (12k+subs)

keyHighlights: Top performing post with 2323 likes and 454 comments drives overall engagement.
Image posts dominate content distribution with 77.63% share and significantly higher engagement.
Thursday and Saturday are optimal posting days with engagement multipliers of 1.27 and 1.64 respectively.
Audience is diverse with a large segment in 'Others' (61.93%), alongside notable interest in Technology and Real Estate.
executiveSummary.summaryText: This report provides an in-depth analysis of Brad Hargreaves' LinkedIn performance over the analyzed period. It synthesizes data across content types, audience demographics, and posting patterns to highlight strengths and opportunities. The analysis identifies key trends such as dominant image performance and optimal engagement days. Overall, the report offers actionable insights to further enhance engagement and content strategy.

contentAnalysis.visualImpactInsight: Image posts (avg engagement: 136) tend to perform significantly better than text posts (avg engagement: 21).
contentAnalysis.postTypeDistributionInsight: Image posts dominate with 77.63% distribution, driving higher engagement compared to other post types.

topPerformingPosts.content: America's biggest land users aren't cities or suburbs. It isn't farms growing food. It's cows. The real breakdown of US land use is detailed in this post.
This isn’t a population map. It's America's land values. The post highlights surprising facts and geographic insights into American wealth.
A 50-year-old office building is set to become Dallas’s new family hub, transforming urban country clubs. The post explains the emerging trend and innovative approach.
The chart post compares market predictions with reality in real estate, highlighting miscalculations and offering insights into interest rate impacts.

commonCharacteristicsTopPosts: High visual content with dominant image use
Clear industry insights and detailed narratives
Strong relevance to current real estate trends

audienceAnalysis.audienceInsight: The majority of the audience falls under 'Others' (61.93%), indicating diverse interests with significant segments in Technology, Real Estate, and Finance.

topIndustryInfluencersAnalysis.overview: Analysis of 4 industry influencers with an average of 58,200 followers reveals diverse content strategies and engagement patterns in the data + AI space.

influencers.name: Ali Ghodsi
influencers.title: CEO & Co-Founder at Databricks, Adjunct Professor at UC Berkeley
influencers.descriptionFocus: CEO and co-founder at Databricks driving big data innovations. Adjunct professor with strong industry influence.

profile.name: Ali Ghodsi
profile.title: CEO & Co-Founder at Databricks, Adjunct Professor at UC Berkeley

post.text:
In just two weeks, we revolutionized Dolly. Introducing the first open source, instruction-following LLM, fine-tuned on a human-generated instruction dataset licensed for commercial use. 

With Dolly 2.0, any organization can create, own, and customize a powerful LLM without sharing their proprietary data with 3rd parties or paying for API access. The model uses a new dataset, “databricks-dolly-15k,” which is made up of more than 15,000 records generated by thousands of Databricks employees. It’s the first open source, human-generated instruction dataset specifically designed to make LLMs exhibit the magical interactivity of ChatGPT (instruction following). 

We’re open-sourcing the entirety of Dolly 2.0, including the training code, dataset, and model weights, all suitable for commercial use.

https://bit.ly/43oXmsy 

#llm #dolly #lakehouse #databricks

influencers.name: Barr Moses
influencers.title: Co-Founder & CEO at Monte Carlo
influencers.descriptionFocus: Co-founder of Monte Carlo, leading data and AI reliability. Focuses on data observability and innovation.

post.text:
Who owns data quality? 

It’s a question as old as Oracle Version 3, and the answer varies depending on who you ask.

- Some organizations like to spread the responsibility around to multiple team members, each responsible for a few pipelines. 

- Others prefer to concentrate the responsibility on a select few specialists who have a holistic view of the entire platform. 

- And then there are those who view data quality as a technical issue, while others see it as a business or process problem.

But at the end of the day, the only thing that matters is that it gets done. 

Shane Murray and I have spoken to thousands of data leaders over the years to understand the most common ownership models for data quality, and how data teams can apply them at scale.

From data engineering to data governance teams, our latest explores the pros and cons of each approach: https://lnkd.in/eiUPWypC

(Meme inspired by Chad Sanderson)

#dataquality #dataengineering #datareliability

influencers.name: Bill Schmarzo
influencers.title: Dean of Big Data, CDO Chief AI Officer Whisperer, recognized global innovator, educator, and practitioner in Big Data, Data Science, & Design Thinking
influencers.descriptionFocus: Industry leader in big data and analytics, driving digital transformation with design thinking. Renowned educator and innovator.

profile.name: Bill Schmarzo
profile.title: Dean of Big Data, CDO Chief AI Officer Whisperer, recognized global innovator, educator, and practitioner in Big Data, Data Science, & Design Thinking

post.text:
So, let me ask a stupid question (my specialty): If our existing large language models (LLMs) have already soaked up most of the world's information, why are we trying to update them with synthetic information, which will likely dilute the accuracy and relevance of the actual information already in the LLM?

Instead, shouldn't we teach organizations and individuals how to use RAG and  Contextual Continuity techniques to massage these LLMs to yield more relevant and accurate responses?

If LLMs have reached the law of diminishing returns (and maybe they should just be turned into a public utility for the benefit of all), then let's invest in the people skills and tools to get more value from these marvelous LLM creations.

Prof. Ahmed Banafa Chris Surdak Mark Stouse John Thompson Dan Everett Jon Cooke Malcolm Hawker Dell Technologies Navin Mukraj Cindi Howson Jeff Frick Kyle Winterbottom Renée B. Lahti Kevin Petrie Eddie Short

#AI #LLM #GenAI #RAG #ContextualContinuity #DataScience #ValueEngineering

post.text:
Today we're announcing #apachesuperset 1.0 and our graduation from the incubator at the Apache Software Foundation! 

1.0 is a huge milestone and marks the point where #opensource #businessintelligencebi  is truly ready for mass adoption!

hashtagPerformanceAnalysis.hashtagKeyFinding: Posts with hashtags show an engagement boost, though they represent only 6.7% usage of total posts.

summaryOfComparison: The client shows strong visual content performance and high engagement on key days, but lags behind influencers in posting frequency and content diversity. There is an opportunity to increase the variety of content and to collaborate with influencers to further enhance reach and engagement.

gapAnalysis.recommendedAction: Increase posting frequency to daily updates.
Collaborate with industry influencers to boost visibility.

recommendations.contentStrategy: Leverage high-performing image content with deeper real estate insights to resonate with the target audience.
recommendations.visualElements: Increase the use of high-quality visuals to capitalize on the higher engagement observed for image posts.
recommendations.postingSchedule: Optimize posting on Thursday and Saturday, when engagement rates are highest.
recommendations.audienceTargeting: Tailor content to the engaged segments in Real Estate, Technology, and Finance for better resonance.
recommendations.engagementTactics: Enhance interactive elements, such as polls and questions, to drive more comments and shares.
